DESCRI

description: Listed building consent for demolition of outrigger building and existing WC block and the erection of a single storey extension on the eastern facade of Grade II Listed Kingston Museum and Library
site_name: Land At Former Kingfisher Leisure Centre
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to the commencement of the works hereby approved, a detailed Mechanical and Electrical systems strategy, as it relates to the adaptation of historic fabric, shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The strategy shall include details of any plant/air source heat pumps/vents and the like including, if necessary, how they will be screened.The works shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy.Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of this building

Prior to the commencement of the works hereby approved accurate demolition plans which clearly indicate the historic fabric and historic plan form that will be lost shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved plans.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of this building.

The development hereby approved shall ensure the retention of all historic fabric and features, the use of like for like replacements and existing ducts and conduits. Specifically wooden panelling, doors, staircases, coving, plasterwork, and coffered/vaulted ceilings where they appear shall be retained and appropriately protected during the course of the worksReason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

A Conservation Management plan shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval which sets out the heritage significance of the relevant parts of the listed building affected by the development works and identifies how that heritage significance can be sustained and enhanced through future use. The conservation management plan should set out details of its ongoing monitoring and review.The works shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Management Plan.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

Prior to commencement of works, details relating to railings and boundary treatments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Information shall include written description and manufacturer specification details of the proposed materials, colours and finishes. The railings / boundary treatment shall be provided before the beneficial occupation of the extension hereby approved.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

The interior features of the building shall be protected against accidental loss or damage during building work, and no features may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except if so identified on the drawings forming part of this consent.Reason: In order to safeguard the special architectural or historic interest of this building.

All other existing internal decoration features, including plaster work, ironwork, fireplaces, doors, windows, staircases, staircase balustrade and other woodwork, shall remain undisturbed in their existing position, and shall be fully protected during the course of works on site unless expressly specified in the approved drawings. Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12
